meanings.definition: Treated or protected to resist damage or destruction by moths.
meanings.sent1: My new sweater is mothproof, so I don't have to worry about moths ruining it.
meanings.sent2: It is important to use mothproof storage bags for delicate clothes to prevent moth damage.
meanings.sent3: The mothproof blanket was like a superhero protecting the closet from moth villains.
meanings.sent4: Her mothproofing skills were so strong that even the most determined moths couldn't harm her clothes.
meanings.sent5: The mothproof shield around the wardrobe glowed with protective energy, keeping moths at bay.

meanings.definition: To make something resistant to damage or destruction by moths.
meanings.sent1: I need to mothproof my wool coat before storing it for the summer.
meanings.sent2: She decided to mothproof her attic to safeguard her old books from moth infestations.
meanings.sent3: He tried to mothproof his garden shed by hanging up fragrant herbs to repel moths.
meanings.sent4: The tailor mothproofed the expensive fabric by using special chemicals to deter moths.
meanings.sent5: The homeowner diligently mothproofed all the closets in the house to protect the clothes inside.
